main event: A bright red streak, the size of a pea, was observed moving along Gila River in Arizona on 25 November 1957 for 3 minutes.
interesting points: The observation was classified as ground-visual, indicating a sighting from the ground.
The source of the observation was a civilian.
The conclusion was that the sighting was probably astronomical, with the comment 'Sputnik II'.
The report mentions other UFO sightings on different dates and locations, all found to be bona fide satellites.
This sighting was in the same month as the launch of Sputnik II on 3 November 1957, adding to the mystery.
